title_tr: The Epistle of Grief
author_tr: Ibn al-Mubarak reported that he heard that some people were talking about a certain man who was always sad. So, he went to him and told him, 'O my brother! I have heard that you are always sorrowful. Is there any problem that has befallen you?' The man replied, 'Yes, indeed. My wife is the cause of my sadness.' Ibn al-Mubarak asked, 'What did your wife do to make you sad?' He answered, 'She is very bad-tempered and short-tempered; she never keeps company with me in a good manner. Therefore, I have no peace at all.' Ibn al-Mubarak said to him, 'If that's the case, why don't you divorce her? If she causes trouble for you, then divorce her!' The man replied, 'But I am afraid of falling into sin if I leave her because of her bad character. So, how can I deal with this?' Ibn al-Mubarak said to him, 'Do not fear anything in the least! For indeed, God says:
